AspectJ.answer:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

answer.title: Bug 11280[View Mgmt] Switching perspectives loses view maximized state
answer.description: The CVS repository view is no longer maximized. A view that is maximized should stay maximized.
answer.OB: The CVS repository view is no longer maximized after switching perspectives.
answer.EB: The CVS repository view should stay maximized after switching perspectives.
answer.SR:
1. Open the CVS repository view in the Java perspective.
2. Double click the title bar to maximize it.
3. Switch to the resource perspective.
4. Come back to the Java perspective.

In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

answer.title: Bug 151938 Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully
answer.description: If you start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it chokes badly: it tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. If the script is wrapped twice, it can generate a duplicate.
answer.OB: If you start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it chokes badly: it tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. If the script is wrapped twice, it can generate a duplicate.
answer.EB: Bug 151938 Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully It would be better if AspectJ detected that it was specified more than once and gave a warning then disabled all but one of the agents.
answer.SR: 1. Start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag. 2. If there is an aop.xml file defined, the VM will choke. 3. The issue arises when the script is wrapped twice, resulting in a duplicate javaagent entry.

(I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes nosense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.) ', 'OB': 'In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form "app.Main.class" rather than "app/Main. </BUG REPORT>

{"id": "37021", "title": "Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files", "description": "Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]". See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem. Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filename checking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes no sense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.)", "OB": "In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' rather than 'app/Main.class'", "EB": "", "SR": "Follow these steps to reproduce the issue: 1. Open the Bug 37021 source code in your preferred Java IDE. 2. Build the project to generate .class files. 3. Run the project with the .class files to trigger the declare warning messages. Observe that the sourcepath is listed in the form 'app.Main.class' instead of 'app/Main.class'."}

answer.title: Bug 151938 Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully
answer.description: Failing that, it would be better to fail and give an error message than emit the bytecode. This issue came up for our automated installer, which adds a javaagent flag to VM startup commands. We are making our scripts more intelligent to avoid this issue, but we are probably not the only people who will hit this issue (e.g., if someone manually edits both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the flag for a Tomcat instance...)
answer.OB: The software emits bytecode when it detects duplicate javaagent entries, which causes issues in the VM startup commands.
answer.EB: The software should detect duplicate javaagent entries and give a warning or fail with an error message instead of emitting bytecode.
answer.SR: 1. Edit setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the javaagent flag for a Tomcat instance.2. Manually edit both setclasspath.bat and catalina.bat to add the javaagent flag for a Tomcat instance.

answer.title: Bug 269522[handles] Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
answer.description: Bug 269522[handles] Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
answer.OB:
Select line 22 and note that you see 5 joinpoints (should only be 3).
Select line 68 and note that you see zero joinpoints (should be 2 here).
Right-click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises'. Note that you see all 5 joinpoints.
answer.EB: The software should only show 3 joinpoints for line 22 and 2 joinpoints for line 68. When right-clicking a marker, it should show the correct set of joinpoints.
answer.SR:
1. Select line 22 and note that you see 5 joinpoints (should only be 3).
2. Select line 68 and note that you see zero joinpoints (should be 2 here).
3. Right-click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises'. Note that you see all 5 joinpoints.

answer.title: Bug 151938 Handle Duplicate javaagent entries more gracefully
answer.description: If you start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it chokes badly: it tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. If the script is wrapped twice, it can generate a duplicate.
answer.OB: If you start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag, if there is an aop.xml file defined, it chokes badly: it tries to reweave the woven AspectJ code and emits massive amounts of bytecode. If the script is wrapped twice, it can generate a duplicate.
answer.EB: The software should gracefully handle duplicate javaagent entries without causing errors or emitting excessive bytecode.
answer.SR: 1. Start a java 5 VM with AspectJ's loadtime weaver specified more than once using the javaagent flag.2. If there is an aop.xml file defined, the software should fail and give an error message instead of emitting bytecode.

answer.title: Column icons don't show up in connecting derby database

answer.OB: In Avaiable Items sector, expand Data Source by clicking the related icon.
answer.EB: In Avaiable Items sector, expand Data Source by clicking the related icon. Expected Result: table icons and column icons will show up. Actual Result: column icons don't show up.
answer.SR: The Steps of Reproduce: 1. New a project 2. New a report 3. In Data Explorer view, New a Data Source to connect derby database: Driver Class: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver Database URL: jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/gui User Name: root Password: root 4. After set up Data Source, create a dataset 5. In Edit Data Set Data Set window, select Query. 6.

answer.title: Bug 121323XML Edit Data Set dialog does not persist filter information
answer.description: If one enters an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selection part like section[@id='left'] then within class RelationInformation theselection is stripped of and stored in filterInfo HashMap. When leaving the dialog, RelationInformation gets persited to .rptdesign but data stored in filterInfo is lost. However, IMHO treating XPath expressions in that way will lead to a lot of trouble.
answer.OB: The XML Edit Data Set dialog does not persist filter information when leaving the dialog.
answer.EB: The XML Edit Data Set dialog should persist filter information when leaving the dialog.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, enter an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selection part like section[@id='left'] in the dialog, and then leave the dialog. The filter information should be persisted, but it is lost.

', 'OB': 'But in fact BEFOREFIRSTROW only works when the cursor is just to enter the first row, and AFTERLASTROW only works when cursor is just to leave the last row. Once the iteration is finished, both type won\'t work anymore. Also, current BEFOREFIRSTROW/AFTERLASTROW name is misleading, better change to ONSTARTROW, ONENDROW or others which are more clarified.This bug currently blocks chart to evaluate those nondatarow expressions(i.e. expressions from title url action) which are not within a datarow iteration(Chart need to evaluate these expreesions from action after data binding). ', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'A "QueryResults or its iterator has been closed" DataException will be thrown out if you try to evaluate these expressions.But actually, these global expressions is nothing to do with the data row iteration. '}

answer.title: Bug 122584Cascading parameter values can't be displayed properly in html viewer.
answer.description: Description: Cascading parameter values can't be displayed properly in html viewer.Steps to reproduce:1. Preview attached design file in html viewer.2. Click on "change parameter" button in html viewer.3.
answer.OB: Bug 122584Cascading parameter values can't be displayed properly in html viewer. Select the first parameter value and expect that the second parameter value in the same cascading parameter group could be displayed, but it is not displayed.
answer.EB: The second parameter value in the same cascading parameter group should be displayed when the first parameter value is selected.
answer.SR: Preview attached design file in html viewer.2. Click on 'change parameter' button in html viewer.3.

answer.title: Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask
answer.description: Bug 122423Support page range in RenderTask If so, parse it and form a range and output them one after another, with a page splitter in between just like the runAndRenderTask. There can only be one page in case a page number is set.
answer.OB: Support page range in render task.For PDF format, simply log a message saying range is not supported if a range is specified, and still output whole report.For HTML format, support page range in the form of '1,2,510' + 'All'. Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned.
answer.EB: The code should check if there is range set. Invalid page number should be logged, and error message is returned. If neither is set, we default to all pages, instead of the current behavior of giving an error message.
answer.SR: 1. Parse the page range input.2. If the input is in the format '1,2,510' + 'All', split the range into individual pages and output them one after another, with a page splitter in between. If the input is in the format 'All', output all pages.3. If the input is in the format '1,2,510', output only the specified pages.4. If the input is not in any of the above formats, log an error message and return an error.5. If there is no input, output all pages by default.

answer.title: Bug 124620Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted
answer.description: The Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in the library is deleted.
answer.OB: Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened. But if those operations happened in dataset, the icon of dataset in the report will be invalid.
answer.EB: The Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in the library is deleted.
answer.SR: 1. Insert a report scalar parameter.2. Create a report, use the above library. In the library explorer, pull the parameter to the data explorer view of report.3. Open the library file, delete the parameter. Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened. The icon of dataset in the report should be invalid if the parameter in the library is deleted.

answer.title: Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
answer.description:
Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table This design uses a 2level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this:
row['FIRSTNAME'] + ' ' + row['LASTNAME'] + ' / ' + row['OFFICECODE']
However this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on 'COUNTRY' is to insert
rows[0]['COUNTRY']into the expression.
The first index (an integer) to the 'rows' array is the 0-based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first level inner table etc.).
answer.OB: The report designer generates an incorrect column reference expression for the inner table.
answer.EB: The report designer should correctly determine the index number of the nested table based on its nesting level and insert the appropriate column reference.
answer.SR: Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). To do this, double-click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression. Click on 'Available Data Sets', choose data set 'offices', then double-click on column 'COUNTRY'.

answer.SR:
1. Open the attach file.
2. Create a chart and choose the select data page.
3. Use the Join dataset and set the X and Y series.
4. Apply a filter with row['Data Set1::EMPLOYEEID'] = 1.

answer.title: JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
answer.description: The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source. On the iSeries platform using the JTOpenJDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system. This is easily several hundred tables. Using the code in CVS from 6/30/05, I see the schema filter, however I still have the warning message on load since the tree is being populated on load.
answer.OB: On the iSeries platform using the JTOpenJDBC drivers, this tree control shows every schema (aka catalog) on the system. This is easily several hundred tables. Using the code in CVS from 6/30/05, I see the schema filter, however I still have the warning message on load since the tree is being populated on load.
answer.EB: The JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand, showing only the relevant schema(s) and tables, and filtering out the rest. The user should not have to wait for the entire list of schemas to load before they can start using the editor.
answer.SR: 1. Click on the SQL Query tab in the JDBC Data Set Editor. 2. Verify that the tree control displays the schema(s) and tables relevant to the selected SQL Query. 3. Observe that the tree control is populated on demand, without displaying the entire list of schemas on the system.

answer.title: Bug 102516JDBC Data Set Editor should load tables and columns on demand
answer.description:

Could the load of the tree be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter?
answer.OB: The JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query has a tree control that lists the tables and columns in your data source. The tree control is initially empty and does not show any tables or columns.
answer.EB: The tree control should be initially empty and not show any tables or columns, but the load of the tree should be deferred until the user expands the tree or applies a filter.
answer.SR:
1. Open the JDBC Data Set Editor page for a SQL Query.
2. Expand the tree control or apply a filter to load the tables and columns.

answer.title: Bug 120922: Dirty Page behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved
answer.description: Bug 120922: Dirty Page behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improved. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. (including the quotes). And then the user needs figure out how to save or discard their changes. Do you want to save the changes?<Yes <No <CancelYes would save the changesNo would discard the changesCancel would do nothing and remain on the Source pageIn addition, the dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
answer.OB: If you edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor, and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes.This problem is the user has to figure out what he needs to do to save the changes (or discard them, which is even harder), and the error message is not very good.The error message is 'Source page is dirty.'
answer.EB: The software should allow the user to switch back to the Layout view without displaying an error message and requiring the user to save the changes.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.3. Try to switch back to the Layout view.

answer.title: Bug 121323XML Edit Data Set dialog does not persist filter information
answer.description: If one enters an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selectionpart like section[@id='left'] then within class RelationInformation theselection is stripped of and stored in filterInfo HashMap.When leaving the dialog, RelationInformation gets persited to .rptdesignbutdata stored in filterInfo is lost.HoweverIMHO treating XPath expressions in that way will lead to a lotof trouble.
answer.OB: If one enters an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selectionpart like section[@id='left'] then within class RelationInformation theselection is stripped of and stored in filterInfo HashMap.When leaving the dialog, RelationInformation gets persited to .rptdesignbutdata stored in filterInfo is lost.
answer.EB: The software should store the XPath expression and the corresponding data in the filterInfo HashMap when the user enters it in the XML Edit Data Set dialog. When the user leaves the dialog, the RelationInformation class should be persisted to .rptdesign with the data stored in the filterInfo HashMap.
answer.SR: 1. Enter an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selectionpart like section[@id='left'] in the XML Edit Data Set dialog.2. Save the changes.3. Leave the dialog.4. Verify that the RelationInformation class is persisted to .rptdesign with the data stored in the filterInfo HashMap.

answer.title: Bug 123727 - 'Top N' and 'Bottom N' buttons not working
answer.description: Bug 123727 - The 'Top N' and 'Bottom N' buttons in the 'areport' component are not functioning as expected.
answer.OB: When the 'areport' component is loaded, the 'Top N' and 'Bottom N' buttons do not respond to user clicks.
answer.EB: The 'Top N' and 'Bottom N' buttons should allow users to navigate through the list of items in the 'areport' component.
answer.SR:
1. Open the 'areport' component.
2. Click on the 'Top N' or 'Bottom N' buttons.

answer.title: Bug 124570Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session
answer.description: Bug 124570Preview from toolbar always shows first report opened in session
answer.OB: I am testing BIRT 2.0 RC2 and am running into a problem where Preview (from the toolbar) in the Web Viewer will only show the first report I opened in a session.
answer.EB: The Preview feature in the toolbar should display all reports opened in the session.
answer.SR: 1. Open BIRT 2.0 RC2. 2. Create a new report. 3. Open the Web Viewer. 4. Click on the Preview button in the toolbar. Expected result: The preview should show all the reports opened in the session. Actual result: The preview only shows the first report opened in the session.

answer.title: Bug 124620Referenced Parameter icon should be invalid if the parameter in library is deleted

answer.OB: Then reopen the report design file, the icon of parameter seems nothing happened. But if those operations happened in dataset, the icon of dataset in the report will be invalid.
answer.EB: The icon of the parameter in the report should be invalidated when the referenced parameter in the library is deleted.
answer.SR:
1. Open the report design file.
2. Delete the referenced parameter from the library.
3. Reopen the report design file.
Expected result: The icon of the parameter in the report should be invalid.
Actual result: The icon of the parameter in the report remains the same.

answer.description: Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements This is not even NLS specific defect. Otherwise the query will fail.1. Create table with name including blank in this database. Select 'Preview Results'Result: Exception is fired.7. 'Table Name'. 'Column Name'8.
answer.OB: It happens with English as well.The problem is that on the Query screen in the Edit Data Set dialog the drag/drop of columns into the Query screen must enclose every entity name including blank in the quotation marks. Select 'Preview Results'Result: No exception is issued.
answer.EB: The software should allow the drag/drop of columns into the Query screen without firing an exception, regardless of the entity name, including blank.
answer.SR: 1. Create a table with a name including a blank in the database. 2. Select 'Preview Results' 3. Drag/drop columns into the Query screen, ensuring that every entity name, including blank, is enclosed in quotation marks.

answer.title: Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
answer.description:
Bug 131649Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table This design uses a 2level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this:
row['FIRSTNAME'] + ' ' + row['LASTNAME'] + ' / ' + row['OFFICECODE']
However this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on 'COUNTRY' is to insert
rows[0]['COUNTRY']
into the expression.The first index (an integer) to the 'rows' array is the 0-based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first level inner table etc.).
answer.OB: The software generates an incorrect column reference expression for the inner table.
answer.EB: The software should generate the correct column reference expression for the inner table, which is rows[0]['COUNTRY']
answer.SR: Open the attached report design (test1.rptdesign). To do this, double-click on the inner list's Data Item to edit its expression. Click on 'Available Data Sets', choose data set 'offices', then double-click on column 'COUNTRY'.

answer.title: Bug 2529[Navigator] Open/Close project not always available (1GFKW5S)
answer.description: Bug 2529[Navigator] Open/Close project not always available (1GFKW5S) Now select both P1 and P2.
answer.OB: Notice the Open Project menu item is available but the Close Project is not.
answer.EB: The Open Project menu item should always be available, and the Close Project menu item should also be available when the Open Project menu item is selected.
answer.SR: Create two projects P1 and P2. Select P2 and close it.

answer.title: Bug 2694Editor Selection Dialog: UI suggestions (1GI6RPE)
answer.description: Bug 2694Editor Selection Dialog: UI suggestions (1GI6RPE) press Add for the associated editors.a. Multiple selection could be enabledc. The default entry in the associated editors list could be marked (default) (see perspectives)NOTES:KLM (10/10/2001 1:54:57 PM)Also:f. Need a width hint for the dialogg. Why does the File editors Pref page grow in height when it is selected, but no other pagesdo the same?I currently have fixes for a, c, fNeed to releaseKLM (10/10/2001 5:58:58 PM)released fixes for a, c, f, g
answer.OB: The 'Add' button in the Editor Selection Dialog does not add a hidden entry to the associated editors list.
answer.EB: The 'Add' button should add a hidden entry to the associated editors list.
answer.SR: MA (09.08.2001 12:04:06)1. In the preference page, go to Workbench > File Editors.2. Without selecting anything from the 'Internal Editors', go to 'External Editors' and select an entry.Switch back to Internal: The selected external editor should now be available for selection. However, the 'Add' button should not add a hidden entry to the associated editors list.

answer.SR: Consider the following scenario: Unix and Windows workstations are used to develop a Unix product/program. The user needs to create a new file, and they want to specify the line delimiter as something other than the default system delimiter.

answer.title: ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet
answer.description: From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com wrote in messagenews:3C407F76.31A82113@us.ibm.com...
answer.OB: The combo box does not size correctly in the property sheet, and the drop-down button may be clipped if the string is wider than the width of the property sheet column.
answer.EB: The combo box should always be the width of the property sheet column, and the drop-down button should be visible without being clipped.
answer.SR: To reproduce, create a property sheet with a ComboBoxCellEditor in one of its columns. Observe that the combo box may not be the correct size, and the drop-down button may be clipped if the string is wider than the width of the property sheet column.

answer.title: Bug 7734: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
answer.description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. No warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.
answer.OB: The system is shut down without any warning or question message box to save the dirty model(s).
answer.EB: The system should provide a dialog box asking if the user wants to save their file before shutting down/rebooting the computer.
answer.SR:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select Shut Down command to shutdown/reboot the computer.
5. Results: There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.

answer.title: Bug 7752 - Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails.
answer.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select File > Export and select Zip File to export

Expected Behaviour: The zip file should be able to store files with the same name under different directories.

Actual Behavior: The zip file fails to store files with the same name under different directories.
answer.OB: The zip file fails to store files with the same name under different directories.
answer.EB: The zip file should be able to store files with the same name under different directories.
answer.SR:
1. Launch WSWB and create two projects
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as 'foo.txt')
3. From the main menu, select File > Export and select Zip File to export

answer.title: Bug 7785SaveAs Forgets the file type
answer.description: The icon has also changed from the parent javafile icon to a generic file icon. The file is for all intents and purposes now a generic file, as opening it will prove the file is opened as text. Expected Behaviour: The file should be saved with the same extension as the original unless explicitly changed. Steps to Reproduce: 1) Open an existing Java file. 2) Modify it (I moved an existing class). 3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save Icon. A dialog will come up. 4) Browse for a valid container location. 5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested. 6) Click Ok. Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, but with no file extension shown.
answer.OB: The file is for all intents and purposes now a generic file, as opening it will prove the file is opened as text.
answer.EB: The file should be saved with the same extension as the original unless explicitly changed.
answer.SR: 1) Open an existing Java file. 2) Modify it (I moved an existing class). 3) Click the SaveAs icon, next to the Save Icon. A dialog will come up. 4) Browse for a valid container location. 5) Type the filename, but ignore the extension, which isn't requested. 6) Click Ok. Observe that the Navigator has added the file in the specified location, but with no file extension shown.

answer.title: Bug 14197 - Removing a working set immediately makes changes
answer.description: Bug 14197 - Removing a working set immediately makes changes
answer.OB: At the moment of delete, the package view in the background refilters.
answer.EB: At the moment of delete, the package view in the background should refilter. In my opinion, refiltering should only happen when closing the working set selection dialog, not while manipulating. I also think that pressing cancel should cancel all changes I did to working sets (cancel the remove).
answer.SR: 1. Create a working set with one project and select it.2. Open the working set dialog again, create a second working set, delete the first.

answer.title: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.description: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.OB: from a clean F1 build,import all plugins from runtime environment to get some projectspack a project (say org.eclipse.ant)go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine.close the project.forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Clickit and it doesn't seem to do anything. Notice now 'GoInto' is disabled.
answer.EB: The 'Go Into' action should enable the user to navigate to a specific location within a project. The 'Go Into' action should work as expected, taking the user to the specified location without any issues.
answer.SR: 1. From a clean F1 build, import all plugins from the runtime environment to get some projects. 2. Pack a project (e.g., org.eclipse.ant). 3. Go into the project. 4. Go up, go back, go back, works fine. 5. Close the project. 6. Forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Click forward, then back.

answer.title: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.description: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.OB: The 'Go Into' action in the Navigator View is not working as expected.
answer.EB: The 'Go Into' action should navigate to the specified project or folder.
answer.SR: 1. Import all plugins from the runtime environment to get some projects. 2. Pack a project (say org.eclipse.ant) 3. Go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine. 4. Close the project. 5. Forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Click forward then back.

answer.title: Bug 18335Perspective contents lost when view is maximized
answer.description: Bug 18335Perspective contents lost when view is maximized All the contents of the perspective (views, layout info) is lost when thefollowing actions are performed in F1:Maximize a view in any perspective. Observe that only the maximized view is actually present and all otherviews are missing from the perspective.As far as I can remember, view maximize code replaced the page layout with atemporary one that contained only the maximized view.
answer.OB: Bug 18335Perspective contents lost when view is maximized All the contents of the perspective (views, layout info) is lost when thefollowing actions are performed in F1:Maximize a view in any perspective. Observe that only the maximized view is actually present and all otherviews are missing from the perspective.As far as I can remember, view maximize code replaced the page layout with atemporary one that contained only the maximized view.
answer.EB: This temporary layout must be getting persisted instead of the proper layout when the workbench is closed.
answer.SR: Steps to Reproduce:1. Open a perspective.2. Maximize a view in the perspective.3. Observe that only the maximized view is present and all other views are missing.Expected Behavior:The perspective should retain the layout and contents of all views when the workbench is closed.Bug Report:The temporary layout is getting persisted instead of the proper layout when the workbench is closed, resulting in the loss of contents of all views in the perspective.

answer.title: Bug 23267[Import/Export] Import Project should have a default folder
answer.description: Bug 23267[Import/Export] Import Project should have a default folder
answer.OB: When importing an existing Eclipse project on XP and clicking the Browse button, I get a dialog that does not have a good default folder. It shows me the desktop, my computer, etc... If none, it could point to the default content location.
answer.EB: The software should provide a default folder for the imported project when the user clicks the Browse button.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, perform the following steps: 1. Import an existing Eclipse project on XP. 2. Click the Browse button.

answer.title: Bug 2120MRU File List is not persisted between sessions
answer.description: Notice how files do not appear in File menu MRU list. These files should be persisted between sessions. NOTES: DS (5/23/01 3:36:30 PM) Note: We should be using the IPersistableElement. Do not peek into the implementation to get the underlying resource. The IEditorInput may not be a resource.
answer.OB: Notice how files do not appear in File menu MRU list. These files should be persisted between sessions.
answer.EB: The File menu MRU list should display the files that were previously opened and saved. These files should be persisted between sessions.
answer.SR: 1. Open the application. 2. Close the application. 3. Reopen the application. 4. Observe that the files from the previous session are not displayed in the File menu MRU list.

answer.description: Bug 2940Export Zip: Updating of checkboxes should use busy cursor (1GKWVMA) MA (01.10.2001 11:38:21)1.
answer.OB: The software does not display a busy cursor while updating the selected checkboxes.
answer.EB: The software should display a busy cursor while updating the selected checkboxes to indicate that the operation is in progress.
answer.SR:

4. Press Ok.

answer.OB: The user is unable to add external editors to the associated editors list when multiple selection is enabled, and the default entry in the list is marked (default).
answer.EB: The software should allow the user to add external editors to the associated editors list when multiple selection is enabled, and the default entry in the list is marked (default).
answer.SR: 1. In the preference page, go to Workbench > File Editors.2. Without selecting anything from the 'Internal Editors' tab, go to 'External Editors' and select an entry.Switch back to Internal: (Still no selection), press OK. This should add the selected external editor to the associated editors list.

answer.title: Bug 7734 System can be shut down without savefile warnings
answer.description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. Steps To Reproduce: start WSWB and create a new project, create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select Shut Down command to shutdown/reboot the computer. Results: There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook etc. are not affected by this bug.)
answer.OB: Bug 7734System can be shut down without savefile warnings
answer.EB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows should give users a warning or question message box to save their dirty model(s) before shutting down/rebooting the computer.
answer.SR: start WSWB and create a new project, create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select Shut Down command to shutdown/reboot the computer. Results: There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. answer.description: Bug 14197 - Removing a working set immediately makes changes
answer.OB: At the moment of delete, the package view in the background refilters.
answer.EB: At the moment of delete, the package view in the background refilters. In my opinion, refiltering should only happen when closing the working set selection dialog, not while manipulating. 2. Remove the working set.
3. Observe the package view in the background refiltering.

answer.title: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.description: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.OB: from a clean F1 build, import all plugins from runtime environment to get some projects. Pack a project (say org.eclipse.ant) and go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine. Close the project. Forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Click it and it doesn't seem to do anything. Notice now 'GoInto' is disabled.
answer.EB: The software should allow the 'Go Into' action to work as expected, taking the user to the desired location within the project.
answer.SR: 1. Import all plugins from the runtime environment to get some projects. 2. Pack a project (say org.eclipse.ant) and go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine. 3. Close the project. 4. Click on the 'Forward' button, which should take the user to the desired location within the project. 5. Notice that 'GoInto' is disabled.

answer.title: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.description: Bug 17758[Navigator] Navigator View. Problems with 'Go Into' action
answer.OB:
from a clean F1 build,import all plugins from runtime environment to get some projects
pack a project (say org.eclipse.ant)
go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine.
close the project.
forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Click forward then back.
answer.EB: should navigate to the project's source code location
answer.SR:
follow these steps:
1. From a clean F1 build, import all plugins from the runtime environment to get some projects.
2. Pack a project (say org.eclipse.ant).
3. Go into, go up, go back, go back, works fine.
4. Close the project.
5. Forward is still enabled, but the first forward goes to a blank screen. Click forward then back.

answer.title: Bug 18268 - Not finding images and files in NL-specific subdirectories
answer.description: Bug 18268 - Not finding images and files in NL-specific subdirectories build 200205291235Setup Start eclipse. Delete <install/eclipse/org.eclipse.platform2.0.0/eclipselg.gif3. answer.title: Bug 18915[Preferences]
answer.description: Switching between erroneous preference pages should generate an error, not a warning.
answer.OB: If I enter invalid data on any preference pages (and it red flags me on the UI), and I try to select another page without fixing the problem, I get the following warning dialog: 'warningThe currently displayed page contains invalid values'. This should be an 'error' dialog, considering one is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
answer.EB: The software should generate an error dialog when switching between erroneous preference pages, indicating that the user is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
answer.SR: To reproduce, enter invalid data on any preference page, and then try to select another page without fixing the problem.

answer.title: Bug 19458[Navigator] Copy Project dialog UI problems

answer.title: Bug 20249[Help] Change editor/view/perspective F1 help
answer.description:
Bug 20249[Help] Change editor/view/perspective F1 help
When the change editor menu is open, pressing F1 will display some help.
However, the help window closes immediately, before the contents can be read.
If there is supposed to be F1 defined for the change editor menu, then the help window should stay open for the user to read.
answer.OB: Build F2When the change editor menu is open, pressing F1 will display some help.However, the help window closes immediately, before the contents can be read.If there is supposed to be F1 defined for the change editor menu, then the help window should stay open for the user to read.
answer.EB: The help window should stay open for the user to read when F1 is pressed in the change editor menu.
answer.SR: Press F1 in the change editor menu and observe the behavior of the help window.

answer.title: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
answer.description: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
answer.OB: Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.At this point my package name field is empty.What does this message mean?Is this an error?If so, should it be displayed in red with the error icon?
answer.EB: The software should not display a message when the package name field is empty and finish is disabled. Instead, it should display an error message in red with the error icon.
answer.SR: 1. Create a new Java Project2. Select the project3. Enter a package name in the Package Name field

answer.title: Bug 4974Set classpath / output location should be one operation
answer.description: Bug 4974: Set classpath / output location should be one operation. Like the validation (checking classpath and outputlocation at once), the setting of classpath / output location should be offered as one operation. Note that the error message is strange. I guess it should say: '/xy/src' cannot be nested in '/xy'.
answer.OB: The software does not offer the setting of classpath and output location as one operation.
answer.EB: The software should offer the setting of classpath and output location as one operation, like the validation (checking classpath and outputlocation at once).
answer.SR: 1. Create a project with 'src' as the source folder and 'bin' as the output location.2. In the project properties, change the setting to use the project as the source folder and the project as the output location.

answer.title: Bug 5340Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
answer.description:
The progress dialog closes immediately
Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request.
It should either honour the cancellation request or diable the cancel button
(when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
answer.OB:
Bug 5340Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect The progress dialog closes immediately
Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request.
It should either honour the cancellation request or diable the cancel button
(when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
answer.EB:
Bug 5340Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect The progress dialog closes immediately
Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request.
It should either honour the cancellation request or diable the cancel button
(when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
answer.SR:
1) Go to the breakpoints pane in the debug perspective
2) Click the J! button to add an exception
3) In the progress dialog, click cancel.

answer.title: Bug 5473 ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
answer.description: Bug 5473 ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
answer.OB: The text does not move when executing ShiftLeft.
answer.EB: The text should move when executing ShiftLeft, and the behavior should be consistent with the expected visual indentation.
answer.SR: In a default text editor, type in the following: <space><tab>some text<tab>some text2. Now highlight the two lines above and execute ShiftLeft. Notice that nothing moves.

answer.title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
answer.description: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) etc.
answer.OB: The 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4 displays obfuscated class names prominently, such as 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', and 'd'.
answer.EB: The 'All types' dialog in JDK 1.4 should display class names in a clear and readable format, without obfuscation.
answer.SR:
1. Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter
2. Filter out obfuscated class names completely

I suggest option a) Sort lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.

answer.title: Bug 6322 - All types dialog shows obfuscated classes

answer.EB: The obfuscated class names should be less prominent or filtered out completely.
answer.SR: Steps to reproduce:1. Open JDK 1.4 and navigate to the 'All types' dialog.2. Observe the obfuscated class names in the list.Suggested resolution:1. Sort the lower case class names after the ones that start with a capital letter.2. Filter out the obfuscated class names completely.

answer.title: Bug 8142 - No scoped type hierarchy on binary projects
answer.description: Bug 8142 - No scoped type hierarchy on binary projects. I don't understand it.
answer.OB: When I try to view the class hierarchies of the internal jars in a binary project (e.g. 'org.apache.ant), I get:'No declaration of selected members in the chosen hierarchy of 'org.apache.ant'. I would expect to see the class hierarchies of the internal jars. What does this message mean?
answer.EB: I expect to see the class hierarchies of the internal jars in a binary project.
answer.SR: To reproduce, select a binary project (e.g. 'org.apache.ant), then hit F4 to view the class hierarchy.

answer.title: Bug 10654 - Allow all jars in a folder to be added to build path
answer.description: Bug 10654 - Allow all jars in a folder to be added to build path
answer.OB: It would be useful if you could use a classpath variable to point to the whole directory, so that all jar files in that directory are added to the build path. This would be analogous to the installed extensions feature of the Java launcher you can specify the system property java.ext.dirs to point to a list of directories containing jar files to be automatically added to the classpath.
answer.EB: It would be useful if you could use a classpath variable to point to the whole directory, so that all jar files in that directory are added to the build path. This would be analogous to the installed extensions feature of the Java launcher you can specify the system property java.ext.dirs to point to a list of directories containing jar files to be automatically added to the classpath.
answer.SR: When adding jar files to the build path using classpath variables, you have to specify each jar file separately, even if there are several in the same directory. In order to get my code to compile, I had to add in several of the jar files from the WTE plugin directory. This involved manually searching through the jar files to find the missing classes, and adding in the appropriate jars. I believe bug 3887 alludes to this feature (saying it will be deferred), but I haven't been able to find a bug report or feature request directly describing this.

answer.SR:

2. Answer 'yes' to the prompt to create a new project.

answer.title: Bug 13196[Browsing] Consequences of changes
answer.description: Bug 13196[Browsing] Consequences of changes
answer.OB: The behavior of both manipulations is different.
answer.EB: Then both manipulations should behave the same. If there is an open editor, all manipulations should just work on the working copy shown in the editor.
answer.SR: From the user's perspective, there is an unexpected behavioral difference when manipulation source in the type hierarchy and in the method list of the browser perspective. 1) open Java Browsing Perspective 2) select a type 3) select a method in the method list view 4) delete the method (context menu of the method list view) 5) editor becomes dirty (ok) 6) select another type 7) open type hierarchy on this type, dock the hierarchy view 8) select a method in the method list view 9) select the same method in the hierarchy view 10) delete the method (context menu of the hierarchy view) method is deleted on file system, type list view, method list view, editor are all cleared. Note: This is not the case when the editor is dirty.

answer.title: Bug 13620 - The Java Source Attachment Preference Page has text with large amount of white space

answer.EB: It should be at the top like other ones.
answer.SR:

2. Select a source folder
3. Open Properties
4. Select Java Source Attachment
5. [details] You will get an info label in the middle of the dialog.

answer.title: Bug 14943Code Assist does not respect platform line ends
answer.description: Bug 14943Code Assist does not respect platform line ends
answer.OB: Used code assist to create a for loop with temporary variable.The resulting code has LF as linefeeds on a windows machine.
answer.EB: The code assist should respect the platform line endings and use CRLF as linefeeds on Windows machines.
answer.SR:
1. Created a new class
2. Added a method
3. Defined a local variable for an array
4. Used code assist to create a for loop with temporary variable.
The resulting code has LF as linefeeds on a windows machine.

answer.title: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.description: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.OB: The software does not refresh the class file editor when a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED) delta is fired.
answer.EB: The software should refresh the class file editor when a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED) delta is fired.
answer.SR:
1. Build 20020416
2. Change the attached source of a jar.
3. A (FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH | FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED) delta is fired.
4. The UI closes the class file editors opened on the jar for a FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH delta.
5. The UI does not react for a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED) delta.

answer.title: Bug 17618: Changing output location should delete all derived resources
answer.description: Bug 17618: Changing output location should delete all derived resources Thus, it should be possible to remove all derived resources as long as they have been created by the Java builder.
answer.OB: Thus, it should be possible to remove all derived resources as long as they have been created by the Java builder.
answer.EB: Bug 17618: Changing output location should delete all derived resources
answer.SR:
1. Create a project (autobuild on)
2. Import Java sources and resources
3. Change output folder to project/bin
4. All class files are removed (fine)
5. Change output folder back to be the project
6. All class files are removed (fine)
7. Open project/bin
8. All resources are still there
Note: When opening the properties dialog on such a resource, it is tagged as 'Derived'.

answer.title: Bug 17703: EditAdd Task action should use Workbench dialog as Java Editor does
answer.description: The EditAdd Task action should use the Workbench dialog instead of a different dialog when executed from the Java editor's ruler context menu.
answer.OB: When executing the FileAdd Task action from the Java editor's ruler context menu, the system displays a different dialog than when executing the action from the packages view using F1.
answer.EB: The EditAdd Task action should use the Workbench dialog.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Open a Java project in the IDE. 2. Navigate to the packages view. 3. Select a component unit (CU) in the packages view. 4. Execute the FileAdd Task action from the Java editor's ruler context menu. 5. Observe that you get a different dialog than when executing the action from the packages view using F1.

answer.title: Bug 18028Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
answer.description: Bug 18028Rename package doesn't check if all resources are writeable
answer.OB: F1+ create a package with a CU in it make the CU readonly try to rename the package.observe: after finish you get an unexpected exception dialog.
answer.EB: Preconditionchecking should check for read only files inside packages.

In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

answer.title: Bug 18163Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace
answer.description: Bug 18163Add Import should ignore leading/trailing whitespace
answer.OB: When using 'Ctrl+M (Add Import)' with a selection containing leading/trailing whitespace, the operation does not work as expected.

answer.SR: To reproduce, select a node in the editor using 'Shift + Ctrl + Right', and then try to perform 'Ctrl+M (Add Import)' on the selected node. The operation often fails due to the trailing whitespace within the selection.

answer.title: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
answer.description: Bug 3622New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
answer.OB: Invoke New Java Package.Result: Before you type anything the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. At this point my package name field is empty. What does this message mean? Is this an error? If so, should it be displayed in red with the error icon?
answer.EB: The software should not display a message when the package name field is empty and finish is disabled. Instead, it should display a default package creation option.
answer.SR: Follow these steps: 1. Open the New Package Wizard. 2. Click on the Invoke New Java Package button. 3. Before typing anything, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should appear at the top. 4. At this point, the package name field should be empty. 5. The software should not display the message, but instead display a default package creation option.

answer.title: Bug 4121JarExporter causes out of Sync

answer.SR:

3. Overwrite the exported jarfile the second time

In your bug reports, it is essential to provide clear and informative statements for the following categories:
- **Observed Behavior (OB):** This section should describe the relevant software behavior, actions, output, or results. Avoid vague statements like "the system does not work."
- **Expected Behavior (EB):** This part should articulate what the software should or is expected to do, using phrases like "should...", "expect...", or "hope...". Avoid suggestions or recommendations for bug resolution in this section.
- **Steps to Reproduce (SR):** Include user actions or operations that can potentially lead to reproducing the issue. Use phrases like "to reproduce," "steps to reproduce," or "follow these steps."
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections. In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements. Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.

answer.title: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter

answer.SR: Build 204

answer.title: Bug 4964Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
answer.description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches 'dispose(' far better than 'DISPOSED'. Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
answer.OB: The user selected 'DISPOSED' from a list, but the code assistant generated 'button.DISPOSED', which is not the desired outcome. The user has to manually correct the code, which is time-consuming and error-prone.
answer.EB: The automatic code assistant should be more intelligent and provide more accurate suggestions based on the user's input.
answer.SR: 1. Type '(' in the code editor2. The code assistant should suggest 'dispose(' instead of 'DISPOSED'

answer.title: Bug 4974
answer.description: Set classpath / output location should be one operation
answer.OB: 204:1. create a project with 'src' as source folder and 'bin' as output location.2. in the project properties change the setting to use the project as sourcefolder and the project as output location.
answer.EB: The project properties should allow setting the classpath and output location using the project as a single operation.
answer.SR: Follow these steps:1. Create a project with 'src' as the source folder and 'bin' as the output location.2. In the project properties, change the setting to use the project as the source folder and the project as the output location.

answer.title: Bug 5340: Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect
answer.description: The progress dialog closes immediately. Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request. It should either honour the cancellation request or disable the cancel button (when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
answer.OB: Bug 5340Cancelling add exception breakpoint has no effect The progress dialog closes immediately4) Eventually the exception list comes up, it ignored the cancelation request.It should either honour the cancellation request or diable the cancel button(when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run pass false for the canceleableparameter).
answer.EB: The software should either honor the cancellation request or disable the cancel button when calling ProgressMonitorDialog.run with false for the canceleableparameter.
answer.SR: 1. Open the application. 2. Click on the 'Add Exception' button. 3. Cancel the progress dialog by clicking the cancel button. 4. The progress dialog should close immediately. 5. The exception list should appear, and the cancel button should be disabled.

answer.title: Bug 9654: Modify Parameters - Dialog details
answer.description: Bug 9654: Modify Parameters - Dialog details duplicated name validation could be performed on the first page. The first and second column could be merged. The buttons are too small, and when coming up, no table entry is selected. However, both move buttons are enabled. When changing a param name to something very long, the preview is cut off. For example, the dialog comes up huge for methods with many parameters.
answer.OB:
a. Buttons are too small
b. When coming up, no table entry is selected. However, both move buttons are enabled.
c. When changing a param name to something very long, the preview is cut off.
answer.EB: The software should display the dialog with the correct size and selected table entry. The move buttons should be enabled or disabled based on the user's actions.
answer.SR:
1. Click on the 'Modify Parameters' button.
2. Select a method with many parameters.
3. Observe the dialog size and selected table entry.

answer.description: 20020409I on LinuxMotif and w2k:1. Setup JUnit2. Observe: No context menu is shown, instead, it asks me right away if I want to delete the getter/setter as well.
answer.OB: No context menu is shown when deleting fields. Instead, a message dialog appears asking if I want to delete the getter/setter as well.
answer.EB: The context menu should display when deleting fields and not show the message dialog.
answer.SR: 1. Delete a field. 2. Observe the lack of context menu and the appearance of the message dialog.

answer.title: Bug 13189Refactoring  deleting fields  context menu is overriden by message dialog
answer.description: 20020409I on LinuxMotif and w2k:1. Setup JUnit2.
answer.OB: The context menu for the 'fName' field in TestCase.java is overridden by a message dialog when the 'Code GeneratorRemove prefix from field names' option is enabled.
answer.EB: The context menu for the 'fName' field in TestCase.java should not be overridden by a message dialog when the 'Code GeneratorRemove prefix from field names' option is enabled.
answer.SR:
1. Enable the 'Code GeneratorRemove prefix from field names' option.
2. Open TestCase.java.
3. In the outliner, right-click on 'fName'.

answer.title: Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager
answer.description: Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager Same goes for '.jardesc' file. Perhaps a warning in the wizard's header (now that an icon is shown as well) would be better in the case of the '.jardesc' file, then a dialog box at the end. If the user wants that they should use the 'save the manifest in the workspace' option combined with the 'reuse and save the manifest in the workspace' option.
answer.OB: This is because the jar file is created before the overwrite verifications happen. Other notes: the messages 'saving manifest file failed' is perhaps incorrect in this case as the user chose not to overwrite the manifest file (thus it is not really a failure).
answer.EB: The software should create the jar file after the overwrite verifications happen, and display appropriate error messages if the overwrite verifications fail.
answer.SR: 1. Open the jar packager wizard. 2. Choose the files to be packaged. 3. Click 'Next' to proceed. 4. If the user wants to overwrite the manifest file, click 'Overwrite' and proceed. 5. If the user does not want to overwrite the manifest file, click 'Do not overwrite' and proceed. 6. The jar file should be created after the overwrite verifications happen. If the overwrite verifications fail, a dialog box should appear with appropriate error messages. If the user chooses to save the manifest file in the workspace, a dialog box should appear asking if the user wants to reuse the manifest file. If the user chooses to reuse the manifest file, the manifest file should be saved in the workspace before the jar file is created.

answer.title: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.description: Bug 14113Should listen to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas
answer.OB: Build 20020416Right now, when one change the attached source of a jar, aFREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta is fired, which is obviously wrong.As a consequence, the UI reacts by closing the class file editors opened onthis jar, which is right for a FREMOVEDFROMCLASSPATH java delta.However I tried to fix the delta to be a (FSOURCEDETACHED | FSOURCEATTACHED)delta, but the UI would not react.
answer.EB: The UI should react to FSOURCEATTACHED and FSOURCEDETACHED java deltas.
answer.SR: To reproduce, change the attached source of a jar and observe the behavior of the UI.

3. Observe that the resulting code has LF as linefeeds on a Windows machine.

answer.title: Bug 16938DCR: Class File Editor should scroll more naturally
answer.description: 20020521 (F1)(This may not be a debug PRI wasn't sure). So the workaround, if the user wants to scroll through the Class File editor, is to always use the thumb.
answer.OB:
put a breakpoint in a java file, right before a System.out.println statement, debug to the breakpoint, step into the println call (I happened to go in to StringBuffer first
allthat matters is that you do not have the source for the class you just stepped into) a Class File Editor opens, click on the scrollbar's down arrow
Problem: the editor only scrolls one pixel at a time.
Click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a time
Problem: the editor only scrolls about a line at a time when it should be scrolling a page at a time.
Grabbing the thumb and scrolling with that works well.
answer.EB: The Class File Editor should scroll more naturally, allowing users to scroll a page at a time when scrolling the scrollbar's background or using the thumb.
answer.SR:
1. Put a breakpoint in a Java file.
2. Step into the 'System.out.println' call.
3. A Class File Editor opens.
4. Click on the scrollbar's down arrow.
5. Observe that the editor only scrolls one pixel at a time or about a line at a time.
6. Click on the scrollbar's background to scroll a page at a time.
7. Report the issue.

answer.title: Bug 17618 - Changing output location should delete all derived resources
answer.description: When changing the output location of a project, all derived resources should be deleted. Currently, only the class files are removed.
answer.OB:
1. Create a project (autobuild on).
2. Import Java sources and resources.
3. Change output folder to project/bin.
4. All class files are removed (fine).
5. Change output folder back to be the project.
6. All class files are removed (fine).
7. Open project/bin.
8. All resources are still there.
answer.EB: When changing the output location of a project, all derived resources should be deleted. Currently, only the class files are removed.
answer.SR:
1. Create a project (autobuild on).
2. Import Java sources and resources.
3. Change output folder to project/bin.
4. Open project/bin.

Verify that all class files are removed. 5. Change the output folder back to its original location. 6. Verify that all class files are removed again. 7. Open the project/bin folder. 8. Verify that all derived resources are still present.

answer.title: Bug 17993: Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history
answer.description: The Find/Replace dialog (accessed through EditFind/Replace...) has a history of recent searches. When you type in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, it searches for entries from a previous search. If it finds one, it replaces what you have typed with the value from the history. The search of the history is case insensitive, which means that the case of what you have typed may be changed to the case of the value in the history. In some scenarios, this makes it impossible to perform find or replace operations.
answer.OB: I'm using the F1 build. The Find/Replace dialog has a history of recent searches.
answer.EB: Bug 17993: Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history. The current behavior should be changed to something more simple that allows the full range of find and replace operations to be performed while respecting the case of what the user types. Alternatively, the feature should be removed until a more suitable implementation is available.
answer.SR: To reproduce, open a document so that EditFind/Replace... becomes available. You shouldn't be able to perform find or replace operations due to the current behavior.

answer.EB: The software should not replace the typed entry with a value from the history.
answer.SR: To reproduce, open a document so that EditFind/Replace... becomes available. Type 'a' into the Find field. Click 'Find'. Try to type 'A' into the Find field.

', 'EB': "add a private constructor.There are no nonstatic methods in this class, soactually, this would be a good thing to do anyway.Might as well preventpeople from instantiating the class if there's no need to.You're not addingany size, because the compiler gives you a free public constructor anyway.You're just making the contructor private instead of public. answer.title: Bug 23787[Properties dialog] Project Properties  Info page should not use text fields
answer.description: Bug 23787[Properties dialog] Project PropertiesInfo page should not use text fields Integration build 09/17.Looks bad on all motif platforms.
answer.OB: The Project Properties Info page has text fields for Path, Type, etc., which are read-only and cannot be edited by the user.
answer.EB: The Project Properties Info page should use Labels instead of text fields, so that the values for Path, Type, etc., are displayed but cannot be edited by the user.
answer.SR: Select a Project, right-click Properties on the subsequent Info page, and the readonly fields (the values for Path, Type, etc.) should be displayed as Labels.

answer.title: Bug 23787[Properties dialog] Project Properties  Info page should not use text fields
answer.description: Bug 23787[Properties dialog] Project PropertiesInfo page should not use text fields Integration build 09/17.Looks bad on all motif platforms.
answer.OB: This looks fine on Windows, but on Motif, these text fields all get automatic borders, which identify them as user input targets. Additionally, on Solaris/AIX/HPUX, these fields have different colored backgrounds which make them stand out much worse.
answer.EB: The Project Properties Info page should not use text fields.
answer.SR: Select a Project, right-click Properties on the subsequent Info page. The readonly fields (the values for Path, Type, etc.) should not be text fields.

answer.title: Bug 32286ControlExample Button Tab changing styles resets button orientation
answer.description: Ensure that Eclipse is not running. Accept new configuration defaults.4. Thebuttons will change to arrow buttons, pointng up.7.
answer.OB: The Button controls from the SWT Controls example change their appearance to arrow buttons with an upward orientation when the SWT.ARROW property is selected in the styles group.
answer.EB: The arrow buttons should maintain their orientation and alignment when the SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected.
answer.SR:
1. Install the M5 example plugins.
2. Start Eclipse.
3. Go to Window > Show View > Other and select SWT Controls under SWT Examples.
4. Expand the new view if necessary, and click on the button tab.
5. On the right of the pane, select 'SWT.ARROW' in the styles group.
6. Select an alignment other than 'up' from the alignment group.
7. Select a new orientation for the arrows.
8. Then (de)select SWT.BORDER again.

answer.OB: Bug 35156Ctrl+F1 works only on some fields in the help search
answer.EB: A help pop up screen should come up displaying information about the HelpSearch.
answer.SR: OS: LinuxGTKBuild: RC2 with IBMJava2131 JRESteps to reproduce:1.Launch eclipse with DBCS locale.2.Select from the menu bar SearchHelp3.When the window pops up, click on the first text field and press ctrl+F1.Expected Result:Nothing HappensComments:1.This occurs on all DBCS languages.2.This event only happens in the first text field.When cycling through allthe other fields using the tab key, the ctrl+F1 functions properly bydisplaying the correct text.3.The attachment will show exactly which field is not responding to thectrl+F1, for it is circled in red.The fields circled in green work properly.

answer.title: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.description: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.OB: I20030827Out of the box Ctrl+Backspace should delete the previous word.
answer.EB: I20030827Out of the box Ctrl+Backspace should delete the previous word.
answer.SR: Somehow the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word.If I try to reassign the key via the key preference page, it displays Ctrl+Del when I pressCtrl+Backspace.I have a Swiss German Keyboard using Swiss German Locale.

answer.title: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection
answer.description: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.
answer.OB: The CCombo component fires a defaultSelection event when the list is selected using the mouse.
answer.EB: The CCombo component should not fire a defaultSelection event when the list is selected using the mouse. Instead, it should fire a selection event.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, open the application and click on the CCombo component to open the dropdown list using the mouse. Then, select an entry from the list using the mouse. The CCombo component should not fire a defaultSelection event, but instead fire a selection event.

answer.title: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.description: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.OB: When using the Ctrl+Backspace shortcut, the keybinding manager thinks it is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word. Additionally, if I try to reassign the key via the key preference page, it displays Ctrl+Del when I press Ctrl+Backspace. I am using a Swiss German Keyboard with the Swiss German Locale.
answer.EB: The expected behavior is that Ctrl+Backspace should delete the previous word, as it does out of the box.
answer.SR: Please provide steps to reproduce the issue.

answer.title: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms
answer.description: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms. I don't believe we even need to redraw the entire selection background anymore because there is code in StyledTextRenderer.drawLine that creates a style range for the selection. When forcing a redraw of the entire client area, the entire bidi segment is drawn with a selection background. The problem is that DisplayRenderer.drawLineSelectionBackground includes code to redraw the entire selection background and that code does not take bidi segments into account (direction runs). The proper selection background is therefore drawn in StyledTextRenderer.drawStyledLine, taking bidi segments and tab stops into account.
answer.OB: When forcing a redraw of the entire client area, the entire bidi segment is drawn with a selection background.
answer.EB: drawLineSelectionBackground should only be used to render the special line break selection.
answer.SR: To reproduce, force a redraw of the entire client area.

answer.title: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms
answer.description: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms I don't believe we even need to redraw the entire selection background anymore because there is code in StyledTextRenderer.drawLine that creates a style range for the selection.
answer.OB: The StyledText selection is rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms.
answer.EB: The selection background should only be used to render the special line break selection.
answer.SR: To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Use the attached BidiUtil to type one English character followed by three or more Arabic/Hebrew characters. 2. Place the caret at the beginning of the line. 3. Select the next two characters, including one bidi character.

answer.title: Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
answer.description: Bug 13725Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
answer.OB: answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog, double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
answer.EB: The software should allow users to revert changes without significant delay.
answer.SR: 1. Answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog. 2. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it. 3. Repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
