answer.title: Bug 17993 - Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history
answer.description: It would be better if what I type isn't replaced with a value from the history. The current behavior seems to be similar to 'autocomplete' which is particularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full 'autocomplete' feature could be provided.
answer.OB: I'm using the F1 build. The Find/Replace dialog (accessed through EditFind/Replace...) has a history of recent searches. When you type in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, it searches for entries from a previous search. If it finds one, it replaces what you have typed with the value from the history. The search of the history is case insensitive, which means that the case of what you have typed may be changed to the case of the value in the history. In some scenarios this makes it impossible to perform find or replace operations.
answer.EB: The Find/Replace dialog should not replace what I type with a value from the history if it is found. Instead, it should provide a way for me to select from the history or provide a new value.
answer.SR: 1. Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace...) 2. Type in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields 3. The dialog searches for entries from a previous search. 4. If a match is found, it replaces what you have typed with the value from the history. 5. The search of the history is case insensitive.

answer.title: Bug 17993: Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history
answer.description: It would be better if what I type isn't replaced with a value from the history. The current behavior seems to be similar to 'autocomplete' which is particularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full 'autocomplete' feature could be provided.
answer.OB: When you type in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, it searches for entries from a previous search. For example, searching for 'hello' and replacing it with 'hi' then searching for 'Hello' and replacing it with 'Hi' is not possible. Choose 'Edit Find/Replace...', Type 'a' into the Find field. Click 'Find'. Try to type 'A' into the Find field.
answer.EB: It should not replace the typed entry with a value from the history.
answer.SR: To reproduce, type 'a' in the Find field, click 'Find'.

answer.title: Disable scrollbars in ImageAnalyzer example
answer.description: Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)Open the ImageAnalyzer example.Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don't have any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they don't do anything.
answer.OB: Build F2 (20020602)Redhat 7.2, GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only)Open the ImageAnalyzer example.Notice the scrollbars are enabled, and you can move them around, but they don't have any effect. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they don't do anything.
answer.EB: The ImageAnalyzer example should have disabled scrollbars, so that users can't move them around and they don't have any effect. If a small image is opened, the scrollbars should not appear at all.
answer.SR: Follow these steps to reproduce the issue: 1. Open the ImageAnalyzer example. 2. Observe the scrollbars. 3. Notice that they don't have any effect. 4. If you open a small image, like an icon, the scrollbars should not appear.

{"id": "21706", "title": "Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage", "description": "Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage ", "OB": "Well, kind of. And so what if it does? OK, 2047 has a line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil of: static Callback<Void, Void> callback = new Callback<Void, Void>(BidiUtil.class, \"windowProc\", 4); The BidiUtil.class is syntactic sugar for Class.forName(\"org...BidiUtil\"). The problem with this is that method throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is not defined in the CLDC class libraries, which causes us a little problem in the CLDC version of SWT. You'd only see this problem if you verified or used jxeLink or something; the compiler generates the call itself, and just assumes NoClassDefFoundError is around, so you won't ever get a compiler error from the eclipse compiler (nor Sun's compiler). So, I'd like this changed. Here's the simplest way to change to remove the reflection.", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

answer.title: Bug 24877 - Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog
answer.description: Bug 24877 - Cannot get file extension from swt FileDialog. This makes the dialog almost unusable as we cannot determine the correct file extension to append to the file name. Currently, there is no way to get the file extension that the user selected from the FileDialog. We need an API for the FileDialog to return the 'Save as type' field that the user selected.
answer.OB: There's no way to get the file extension that the user selected from the FileDialog. We need an API for the FileDialog to return the 'Save as type' field that the user selected.
answer.EB: The software should return the 'Save as type' field that the user selected in the FileDialog.
answer.SR:
1. Open the FileDialog.
2. Select a file.
3. Observe that the file extension cannot be determined.
4. Expect the software to return the 'Save as type' field that the user selected.

answer.title: Bug 23935Text widget with Tree parent does not lose focus
answer.description: Both widgets are children of the shell. The right tree and text only work on Windows. We can probably work around by creating the text editor as a sibling of the tree and moving it above the tree.

answer.EB: The left tree and text widgets should lose focus when the right tree and text widgets are present.
answer.SR: 1. Open the attached code. 2. Run the code on Windows and Linux. 3. Observe that the left tree and text widgets do not lose focus when the right tree and text widgets are present.

answer.title: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData
answer.description: Bug 27869: StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData. Btw, UTF8 is the default English encoding for Redhat 8. FontMetrics API is also very used by the StyledText. I believe that the metric information should be cached in the StyledText and update only when the font is changed.
answer.OB: Running Eclipse, using the Java Editor: A single key stroke can cause the API Font.getFontData() to be called 13 times. This API is also overused when we are scrolling the StyledText and selecting text. Each Font has 7 FontData, therefore, every time I type 'a' in the Java Editor, 91 (713) FontData will be loaded.
answer.EB: The StyledText should cache the FontMetrics API information to reduce the number of unnecessary calls to Font.getFontData() when scrolling or selecting text.
answer.SR: 1. Open the Java Editor in Eclipse.2. Type 'a' in the StyledText.3. Observe the number of FontData calls made by Font.getFontData().

answer.description: Ensure that Eclipse is not running. Accept new configuration defaults.4. Thebuttons will change to arrow buttons, pointng up.7.
answer.OB: The buttons will change to arrow buttons, pointing up.
answer.EB: The arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons should not be reset to UP when SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected.
answer.SR: Problem Description: When using the Button controls from the SWT Controls example, if SWT.ARROW buttons are used and SWT.BORDER property is selected or deselected, the arrow alignment property of all the arrow buttons is reset to UP. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install the M5 example plugins. 2. Start Eclipse. 3. Go to Window > Show View > Other and select SWT Controls under SWT Examples. Expand the new view if necessary, and click on the button tab. 6. On the right of the pane, select 'SWT.ARROW' in the styles group. Select an alignment other than 'up' from the alignment group. Select a new orientation for the arrows. Then (de)select SWT.BORDER again. Note that the arrows will again change their orientation to 'up'. Found in: OS: HPUX 11.11. Eclipse: V2.1 Build Id: 200302061700 (M5), with M5 example plugins.

answer.title: Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X
answer.description: Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X
answer.OB:
1. Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).
2. Type in a search term into the text box.
3. Hit the return key.

Nothing happens.

Hitting the Return key should do a 'Find' operation (thesame as clicking on the 'Find' button, which is highlighted as the 'default'button in the Find/Replace dialog).
answer.EB: Hitting the Enter/Return key should initiate a 'Find' operation in the Find/Replace dialog.
answer.SR:
1. Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).
2. Type in a search term into the text box.
3. Press the Enter/Return key.

answer.title: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection
answer.description: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.
answer.OB: If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. Standard Combos won't do this. Because of this, you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entry using the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo.
answer.EB: The CCombo should not fire the defaultSelection event when it is selected using the mouse.
answer.SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Click on the CCombo.
3. Use the mouse to navigate and select an entry in the list.
4. Observe that the CCombo does not fire the defaultSelection event.

answer.title: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.description: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.OB: Somehow the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word.If I try to reassign the key via the key preference page, it displays Ctrl+Del when I pressCtrl+Backspace.I have a Swiss German Keyboard using Swiss German Locale.
answer.EB: The keybinding manager should recognize Ctrl+Backspace as a valid keybinding and assign the corresponding command.
answer.SR:
1. Open the key preference page.
2. Attempt to reassign the keybinding for Ctrl+Backspace.
3. Verify that the displayed keybinding for Ctrl+Backspace is correctly assigned to the desired command.

answer.title: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.description: Bug 42225Can't assign command to Ctrl+Backspace
answer.OB: When using the Ctrl+Backspace shortcut, the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word. Additionally, if attempting to reassign the key via the key preference page, it displays Ctrl+Del when pressing Ctrl+Backspace. This issue occurs with a Swiss German Keyboard using the Swiss German Locale.
answer.EB: The software should recognize Ctrl+Backspace as a valid shortcut and not confuse it with Ctrl+Del. Additionally, the key preference page should accurately display the assigned keybinding when pressing Ctrl+Backspace.
answer.SR: 1. Use Ctrl+Backspace to trigger the desired action. 2. Observe that the keybinding manager thinks this is Ctrl+Del and deletes the next word. 3. Attempt to reassign the key via the key preference page. 4. Verify that the assigned keybinding is displayed correctly when pressing Ctrl+Backspace.

answer.title: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection
answer.description: Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.
answer.OB: The ComboBox component should not fire the defaultSelection event when an item in the dropdown list is selected using the mouse.
answer.EB: The ComboBox component should fire a selection event instead when an item in the dropdown list is selected using the mouse.
answer.SR: 1. Open the ComboBox component.2. Select an item in the dropdown list using the mouse.Observe that the defaultSelection event is not fired.Expected behavior: The ComboBox component should fire a selection event instead of the defaultSelection event when an item in the dropdown list is selected using the mouse.

answer.title: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms
answer.description: Bug 42724 - StyledText selection rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms I don't believe we even need to redraw the entire selection background anymore because there is code in StyledTextRenderer.drawLine that creates a style range for the selection.
answer.OB: The StyledText selection is rendered incorrectly on bidi platforms.
answer.EB: The StyledText selection should be rendered correctly on bidi platforms.
answer.SR:
1. Use the attached BidiUtil to type one English character followed by three or more Arabic/Hebrew characters.
2. Place the caret at the beginning of the line.
3. Select the next two characters, including one bidi character.

answer.title: Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first
answer.description: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my other applications' windows.
answer.OB: I use two Eclipse windows. If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my other applications' windows.
answer.EB: The two Eclipse windows should maintain their positions relative to each other when switching between them.
answer.SR: To reproduce, use two Eclipse windows, switch to the first window from another application, and then click on a docked view or perspective in the first window. Observe that the second window moves to the front.

answer.title: Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first
answer.description: If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my other applications' windows.
answer.OB: If I switch in from another application to one Eclipse window, and then click on a docked view, or perspective, the other window comes to the front over my other applications' windows.
answer.EB: The second window should not come to the front when the first window is active.
answer.SR:
1. Switch to the first Eclipse window from another application.
2. Click on a docked view or perspective in the first window.

answer.title: Bug 45145Second window comes to front when using first
answer.description: Unless I click on the Eclipse dock icon, the only time a window should come to the front is if I click on it explicitly (or some behavior takes me to a widget in the other window).
answer.OB: When using the first window, the second window comes to the front.
answer.EB: The second window should not come to the front unless explicitly interacted with or some behavior takes me to a widget in the other window.
answer.SR: Click on the Eclipse dock icon to avoid the second window coming to the front.

answer.title: Bug 49195
answer.description: Specify <Server port="1" in server.xml3. That can be used to differentiate the two use cases.There could be improvements on how to stop Tomcat. System.exit(0) would work regardless of all that.I suppose that jsvc may show the same behaviour, but I have not tried.
answer.OB: The software prints an error message when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service.
answer.EB: The software should not print an error message when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service.
answer.SR: 1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows2. Start the service, and then stop the service.3. Shut down the server through an OS signal, e.g., calling Catalina.stop().

answer.title: Bug 49195
answer.description: Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
answer.OB: Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message The following is printed in the catalina.20100427.log:27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServerSEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.It is just a message. Tomcat stops regardless of it:After printing the message CatalinastopServer() performs System.exit(1) which results in Tomcat shutdown.I think that when service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalinaserver is not null.
answer.EB: Tomcat should stop gracefully when the Windows service is stopped.
answer.SR: 1. Open the Windows Services Manager.2. Locate the Tomcat service.3. Stop the service.4. Verify that the catalina.out log does not contain the error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.'5. Verify that the Tomcat service is stopped.

{'id': '50550', 'title': 'Bug 50550PropFind 404 error after MkCol succes', 'description': 'Bug 50550PropFind 404 error after MkCol succes This suggests this has to do with caching.Note2: This situation sounds similar to call 21288 (FIXED\'DirContext caching problem with Dreamweaver 6 when recursively creating directories\').Reproducable using a jackrabbit client;HttpClient client = new HttpClient();String newDir = "http://localhost:8080/webdav/output/" + UUID.randomUUID() + "/";// Comment out this request to make second propfind succesfulHttpMethod propFindMethod1 = new PropFindMethod(newDir);client.executeMethod(propFindMethod1);propFindMethod1.releaseConnection();HttpMethod mkcolMethod = new MkColMethod(newDir);client.executeMethod(mkcolMethod);mkcolMethod.releaseConnection();HttpMethod propFindMethod = new PropFindMethod(newDir);client.executeMethod(propFindMethod);propFindMethod.releaseConnection(); ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'The mkcol should be preceeded with a propfind to trigger the issue.Steps to reproduceSee the following access log;127.0.0.1[06/Jan/2011:14:09:19 +0100] "PROPFIND /webdav/output/f469e3d6e536407282dad989acaf57a2/ HTTP/1.1" 404 1084127.0.0.1[06/Jan/2011:14:09:19 +0100] "MKCOL /webdav/output/f469e3d6e536407282dad989acaf57a2/ HTTP/1.1" 201 127.0.0.1[06/Jan/2011:14:09:19 +0100] "PROPFIND /webdav/output/f469e3d6e536407282dad989acaf57a2/ HTTP/1.1" 404 1084When the first request would be omitted, the third request would have been succesful, as the following access log shows;127.0.0.1[06/Jan/2011:14:10:39 +0100] "MKCOL /webdav/output/81a97360ea4944d3b764d8c7e60e885e/ HTTP/1.1" 201 127.0.0.1[06/Jan/2011:14:10:39 +0100] "PROPFIND /webdav/output/81a97360ea4944d3b764d8c7e60e885e/ HTTP/1.1" 207 628Note: After a few seconds, the response to propfind for that resource is OK again. ', 'SR': 'A propfind call on a resource returns a 404 error when executed after a mkcol for the same resource. '}
</BUG REPORT>

answer.title: Bug 49195
answer.description: Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message
answer.OB: Bug 49195Using 1 as shutdown port with Windows service works, but prints error message The following is printed in the catalina.20100427.log:27.04.2010 17:49:13 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina stopServerSEVERE: No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.It is just a message. Tomcat stops regardless of it:After printing the message CatalinastopServer() performs System.exit(1) which results in Tomcat shutdown.I think that when service launcher stops Tomcat, Catalinaserver is not null.
answer.EB: The software should not print the error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' when using 1 as the shutdown port with a Windows service. Instead, the software should gracefully shut down without any error messages.
answer.SR: 1. Launch the Windows service.2. Stop the Tomcat server using the Windows service.3. Verify that the error message 'No shutdown port configured. Server not shut down.' is not printed in the catalina.20100427.log file.

answer.title: Bug 49503Connectors do not bind to their ports in Catalina.load(), but only later in start()
answer.description: Bug 49503Connectors do not bind to their ports in Catalina.load(), but only later in start() Testing with trunk at revision 957942, thus this supposedly affects 7.0.0 as well.In TC6 there is a separate prestartup phase when starting Tomcat, to allow Connectors to bind to their ports before other parts of Tomcat are started.IIRC, it is implemented by having separate Bootstrapload(String[]) and Bootstartstart() methods [1]. Essentially, it breaks the fix for BZ 48625.To reproduce:1. The first instance starts successfully.
answer.OB: The first instance starts successfully.
answer.EB: The Connectors should bind to their ports in Catalina.load() method.
answer.SR:
Add the following line to conf/catalina.properties
org.apache.catalina.startup.EXITONINITFAILURE=true
2. Start two Tomcat instances with the same configuration at the same time.

answer.title: Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform
answer.description: Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applicationsometimes ,server's cpu reaches 100%,and keep 100% all the time,until restartthe server.Reproduced with java versions: 1.6.007,1.6.018, 1.6.021.It is duplicate of issue: Bug 46373.It seams that Jetty guys fixed that problem: <http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java.
answer.OB: With this logging we can see that selector.select(timeout) sometimes return zero keys on linux plutform.
answer.EB: The software should not return zero keys when calling selector.select(timeout) on a Linux platform.
answer.SR: 1. Run the application on a Linux platform. 2. Observe the CPU usage reaching 100%. 3. Verify that selector.select(timeout) returns zero keys.

answer.title: Bug 50016bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods
answer.description: Bug 50016bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods Created attachment 26089 [details]improve division of responsibility for isUserInRole and login/logout methodsThere are 2 similar problems that have a bad division of responsibility.1. Request.isUserInRole tries to prevent jacc implementations and is also wrong.In the current tomcat implementation, roleref mappings are first applied to the supplied role and then the target role is tested. jacc requires that this be implemented by constructing a roleref permission with the current servlet name and the supplied (not mapped) role.
answer.OB: The software does not handle the division of responsibility correctly for isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods.
answer.EB: The software should handle the division of responsibility correctly for isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods.
answer.SR: To reproduce, follow these steps: 1. Create a web app with two roles A and B and a servlet S that maps A to B and B to A.

answer.title: Bug 50793Invalid DispatchType in ServletRequestListener on async dispatch
answer.description:
Bug 50793Invalid DispatchType in ServletRequestListener on async dispatch
If a ServletRequestListener is defined, when is invoked after a call to AsyncContextdispatch() the DispatcherType returned from the ServletRequest is REQUEST rather than ASYNC.
answer.OB: If a ServletRequestListener is defined, when is invoked after a call to AsyncContextdispatch() the DispatcherType returned from the ServletRequest is REQUEST rather than ASYNC.
answer.EB: The expected behavior is that when a ServletRequestListener is defined, when is invoked after a call to AsyncContextdispatch() the DispatcherType returned from the ServletRequest is ASYNC.
answer.SR: To reproduce, define a ServletRequestListener and call AsyncContextdispatch().
